channel.title: Pong
channel.description:
I made this a while ago, it's my first game actually. You can play it [url=http://awepsyte.50webs.com/PongGame/PingPong.html]here[/url]. You can play against the computer, at 3 different lvls, against another person and you can add obstacles, which are really unpredictable (little buggy, lol), so watch out with those. As it was my first game, i'm still kinda proud of it. :D Here is the [url=http://awepsyte.50webs.com/PongGame/PingPongApplet.java]source code[/url], but remember, it was my first big applet, and it's not really made in the most efficiënt way, so i don't need comments on the code, thx. :)
Just tell me what you think of it, and rate if you like.
PS: Want it hard? Play against computer at lvl Hard, and add obstacles.
~Supamagier

item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

yea i know, but it’s my first game and I want to keep the first version, so I won’t change it

item.dc:creator: @_Java_Maybe • Java Maybe •
item.description:
@_Java_Maybe wrote:

It’s a nice game but It’s a bit bugged. Sometimes the balls goes out of boundries and the ball gets stuk between paddle and side

Dutch: Goed werk, paar foutjes maar gemakkelijke om te fixen.

item.title: Pong
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

On another topic

Am i stating the obvious or something here? I made an electronic circuit that you connect up to your TV with a chip in it. The game was exactly the same as yours; only you used little push buttons on the circuit board. They also called the game pong…

We already all knew this, zoidberg!

Read full topic

item.title: Pong
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

If you’re ever going to continue with it, you could always add a maximum speed-limit for the ball, to circumvent it from going straight through the paddle.

Else, all in all, it is a pretty nice game.

Read full topic

item.title: Pong
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

@billygotshot --> The paddle moves fine, in my opinion. About the obstacles… I know, cool, eh? lol. That’s a little bug, but I rather like it tbh.

@magma828 --> Indeed, I made the game like the classic game (that’s why black-white), and called it pong aswell. However, I didn’t know what the classic game looked like, so the lay-out was just a guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Pong
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:

the paddle moves to slow for the ball… Also when the ball hits the obstacles it spins around and gets thrown…

Read full topic

item.title: Pong
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

[quote=“supamagier, post:6, topic:194567”]Thanks guys.

@davidude36 --> I know, but that’s only if it goes really really fast, lol.
@kupo --> Yea, I wanted it that way - Ever tried playing against computer hard with obstacles? I would be surprised if you loose with 50-20, lol.
@goato --> Thanks - I know it differs speed a lot, it varies, depending on where you hit the ball, also, the ball goes a little faster when it hits an obstacle.
@Yz85Racer --> I know, there probably is some really stupid stuff in it, I already said it was my first big project using Java, and I was too ‘excited’ when I finished it to loop through the code to see what could be better. :P[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 31, 2008, 02:23:40 PM[/size][hr]EDIT: I looked through the code, and it isn’t dumb, it’s neccesary: firstGame is false when the start button hasn’t been pressed before, and the button only should start a game if you’re not playing already one.

If you mean I should have used: if (firstGame) & if (!playing), I didn’t know that worked too at that time.[/quote]

im sorry, but i have to correct you.
you meant to put

if (firstGame && !playing) {

Read full topic

item.title: Pong
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

Yea, as far as I know, I use it, because keypressed won’t work else. I also requestFocus() on a button press and in the init.

Read full topic

item.title: Pong
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

do you requestFocus() when someone clicks on it? cause i cant get it to see any of my keypresses, i guess its different between windows and KDE

good work btw

Read full topic

item.title: Pong
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

Thanks guys.

@davidude36 --> I know, but that’s only if it goes really really fast, lol.
@kupo --> Yea, I wanted it that way - Ever tried playing against computer hard with obstacles? I would be surprised if you loose with 50-20, lol.
@goato --> Thanks - I know it differs speed a lot, it varies, depending on where you hit the ball, also, the ball goes a little faster when it hits an obstacle.
@Yz85Racer --> I know, there probably is some really stupid stuff in it, I already said it was my first big project using Java, and I was too ‘excited’ when I finished it to loop through the code to see what could be better. :P[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 31, 2008, 02:23:40 PM[/size][hr]EDIT: I looked through the code, and it isn’t dumb, it’s neccesary: firstGame is false when the start button hasn’t been pressed before, and the button only should start a game if you’re not playing already one.

If you mean I should have used: if (firstGame) & if (!playing), I didn’t know that worked too at that time.

Read full topic

item.description:

[code]No offence, the game is cool and stuff.

[quote] if (playing == false) {
if (firstGame == true) {[/code]
??? Etc

I made this a while ago, it’s my first game actually. You can play it here. You can play against the computer, at 3 different lvls, against another person and you can add obstacles, which are really unpredictable (little buggy, lol), so watch out with those. As it was my first game, i’m still kinda proud of it.
